SEARCH
Package ca.openosp.openo.utility

Class MiscUtils

java.lang.Object
ca.openosp.openo.utility.MiscUtils
public final class MiscUtils extends Object
When using the shutdown hook...

In the context of a normal JVM, you only need to use the register and deregister methods where ever appropriate. In your code you can periodically checkShutdownSignaled on long running threads.

In the conext of a application context such as a servlet container. You should register and deregister in the context startup/shutdown methods. In addition you should manually flag set shutdownSignaled=true upon context shutdown as the jvm itself may not be shutting down and no shutdown hook signal maybe sent. Similarly you should set the shutdownSignaled=false upon startup as it may have been set true by a previous context stop even though the jvm itself has not restarted.

-----------------------

This file has been renamed to "Old" because this file should no longer be enhanced. A commons version of this class is made available from the Utils package. There maybe some methods left here which don't entirely make sense or don't make sense in the context of a general purpose project agnostic utility class. This class still exists as "Old" so we can slowly refactor the non sensical code to use the new commons utilities. Any remaining methods which do make sense should then me moved to a generic Oscar Utility class or similar. If the method makes sense in a project agnostic fashion, then it should be moved to the util project itself.

    • setShutdownSignaled

      protected static void setShutdownSignaled(boolean shutdownSignaled)
      This menthod should only ever be called by a context startup listener. Other than that, the shutdown signal should be set by the shutdown hook.

    • sanitizeFileName

      public static String sanitizeFileName(String fileName)
      Sanitizes a file name to ensure it is safe for use and complies with naming conventions .

      - Replace spaces with underscores

      - Remove invalid characters, excluding valid delimiter like -.

      - Remove repeated dots

      Parameters:
      fileName - The original file name to be sanitized. It must not be null.
      Returns:
      A sanitized value of the input file name.
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if the input fileName is null.
